definitions.definition: an organization for people who share an interest or do a sport or activity together

examples.text: a golf/tennis/chess/film club
I **joined a** local canoeing **club**.
They belong to the same golf club.
Grandad is a **member of the** bowling **club**.
For details on **club membership** email the address below.
The club hopes/hope to raise at least $10 000 for six local charities.
She plays at the local tennis club.
Who runs the tennis club?
Anderson took over as club captain.
Anyone interested in umpiring matches should contact the club chairman.
I wrote a letter of complaint to the club secretary.

definitions.definition: the building or rooms that a particular club uses

examples.text: We had lunch at the golf club.
the club bar

definitions.definition: a professional sports organization that includes the players, managers, owners and members

examples.text: Manchester United Football Club
a football/rugby/soccer club
The club has/have signed a new coach for next season.
He is expected to sign for a Premier League club next season.
Atlético Madrid Football Club
one of the top football clubs in the country
Wilkins makes his long awaited debut for his new club.

definitions.definition: a place where people, especially young people, go and listen to music, dance, watch comedy, etc.

examples.text: a jazz club
the club scene in Newcastle
a night out at a comedy club
a new style of music on the London club scene
He toured predominantly on the small club circuit, usually with little or no accompaniment.

definitions.definition: (especially in the UK) an organization and a place where people can meet together socially or stay

examples.text: He's a member of several London clubs.
members of an exclusive club
The gentleman's club has/have finally voted to admit women as members.

definitions.definition: a business that offers items or services cheaply to its members

examples.text: You could become a member of an investment club.

definitions.definition: a heavy stick with one end thicker than the other, that is used as a weapon
a long metal stick with a piece of metal or wood at one end, used for hitting the ball in golf
one of the four suits (= sets) in a pack of cards. The clubs have a black design with shapes like three black leaves on a short stem.

examples.text: the five/queen/ace of clubs

definitions.definition: one card from the suit called clubs

examples.text: I played a club.

definitions.definition: used when something bad that has happened to somebody else has also happened to you

examples.text: So you didn't get a job either? Join the club!

wordOrigin: noun senses 1 to 6 early 17th cent. (as a verb): formed obscurely from club in the sense to hit someone with a stick or heavy object. noun senses 7 to 10 Middle English: from Old Norse clubba, variant of klumba; related to clump.
